articles.title: World Cup Homecoming Brings Argentina to a Halt
articles.description: Crowds thronged the streets of Buenos Aires as Argentina’s men’s national team took a 50-mile victory lap to celebrate its third World Cup title.
articles.content: As Argentina’s national soccer team touched down in Buenos Aires on Tuesday after winning the World Cup, millions of Argentines flocked to greet the players. The government declared their homecoming a national holiday, and the team began a 50-mile vi... [715 chars]

articles.title: Sea of people try to catch glimpse of Argentina football team
articles.description: Team Captain Lionel Messi and the rest of the players waved at fans from the bus as they carried the World Cup trophy aloft after securing the country's third title and its first since 1986.

articles.title: Power line nearly takes out Lionel Messi during World Cup parade
articles.description: Argentina's World Cup celebration almost took a catastrophic turn when a low-hanging power line nearly knocked Lionel Messi and four of his teammates off of a moving open-top bus in Buenos Aires on Tuesday.
articles.content:
That was a close call.
